contextId.information: This sentence gives us information about priestly duties. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: According to the customary way of choosing which priest would ... burn incense

contextId.information: "just as he promised our ancestors he would do." This phrase supplies background information about God's promise to Abraham. AT: "because he promised our ancestors he would be merciful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: as he said to our fathers

contextId.information: This is background information about the importance of Bethlehem. Although it was a small town, King David was born there, and there was a prophecy that the Messiah would be born there. AT: "which was called the city of King David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])

"there was no space for them to stay in the guest room." This was probably because so many people went to Bethlehem to register. Luke adds this as background information. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: there was no room for them in the inn
His parents went ... Festival of the Passover

contextId.information: This word is used here to mark a change from the story to background information about Jesus' age and ancestors. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
"He was his mother's only son, and she was a widow." This is background information about the dead man and his mother. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: the only son of his mother (who was a widow)

contextId.information: This is background information about the man who had demons. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: For a long time he had worn no clothes ... but among the tombs

contextId.information: This is supplied as background information to introduce the pigs. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: Now a large herd of pigs was there feeding on the hillside

contextId.information: This phrase marks a break in the main storyline. Here Luke tells background information about Herod. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This word is used here to mark a break in the main storyline. Here Luke tells information about Peter, James, and John. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This is background information that tells the setting of the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: when many thousands of the people ... they trampled on each other

contextId.information: This is background information about Zacchaeus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: He was a chief tax collector and was rich

contextId.information: This is background information that Luke gives about who Barrabas was. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: Barabbas was a man ... for murder

contextId.information: This is background information about where Barrabas was at that time. It can be stated in active form. AT: "whom the Romans had put in prison ... murder" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who had been put in prison ... murder
